Alternatively upgrade to a modern browser. For six years, John Harris and John Domokos have travelled the UK to get a sense of British politics away from the Westminster bubble. Meanwhile, old-fashioned two-party politics has crumbled amid a rising sense of discontent with the status quo. For their new series, the pair are back on the road, hunting down radical new politics in some unlikely places Where should we go? document.post: What about looking at the Crown Estate and how it affects people's rights? It seems to be a kind of island apart from normal democracy. Is not the City of London Corporation another case in point? And what's the story behind the Tory \"Northern Powerhouse\" scheme, where powerful mayors will leapfrog the political controls found in the rest of the country. And selective council privatising of public services, a look at one of the counties that have put their services (social, youth etc.) out to tender to people like Branson? What these points have in common is what looks like the increase of various types of \"gated cities\" of privilege and dilution of public control in the UK.
